title: Panic Pal
description: Panic Pal is a React Native application with ChatGPT integration. The app is designed to assist individuals in managing & coping with panic attacks, which are intense episodes of fear & anxiety that can lead to symptoms such as shortness of breath, palpitations, & a sense of doom or loss of control. These episodes can significantly impact social interactions, relationships, & overall quality of life.
responsibilities: Developed a journal feature for users to log their experiences & track their progress. Created a contact page to facilitate communication & support for users. Designed & implemented a user-friendly & intuitive login page for a seamless user experience.

features.title: Technologies Used
features.content: React-Native, ChatGPT API, Expo Go, Firebase: Real-time database, Firebase: Authentication, Azure

features.title: Login
features.content: Our app begins with a clean & secure interface that invites users to enter their credentials, with the backend processes powered by Firebase. This choice was made for robust security & efficient data management. Firebase’s authentication system is designed to handle user information securely, providing reliable sign-in & sign-up options using email/password. On the login screen, users with an account can either sign in or recover a forgotten password. For new users, they have the option to create an account.

features.title: Chat
features.content: Users can quickly access intervention techniques via prompt buttons—these are dynamically retrieved from asynchronous storage, ensuring a personalized & responsive support system. The app also conscientiously records the chat history within the asynchronous storage for user privacy while summarizing session data to Firebase, balancing data security & enhancing the AI model’s learning capabilities for future interactions. Our app stores OpenAI’s API key in Azure storage for security.

features.title: Breathing
features.content: The central feature is a prominent circle that serves as a visual guide for breathing, with prompts above encouraging engagement. Below the circle are adjustable sliders labeled ‘inhale’ & ‘exhale,’ allowing users to customize the duration of each breath. In case a user would like to come back to their determined breathing exercise, the time information is stored in asynchronous storage for timing, enhancing the personalized experience.

features.title: Phone
features.content: The app’s phone feature serves as a resource for users in need of immediate human interaction during distressing situations. The ‘Show Hotlines’ button leads to a list of available emergency numbers or mental health support services. Below, there’s a section labeled ‘Contacts,’ with the user’s permission, the app can access & display user contacts to facilitate quick communication with trusted individuals. The ‘Call’ or ‘Text’ buttons streamline the process of reaching out for help.

features.title: Calendar
features.content: This page provides users with a structured & interactive way to track their thoughts & experiences. The top portion displays a weekly calendar view, allowing users to select a day. Below the calendar, there is a ‘Daily Journal’ section with a text input area & a ‘Save Entry’ button, allowing users can record their thoughts or feelings. Any entry on a given day is then listed under ‘Journal Entries’ along with a timestamp, offering a chronological overview of past entries. Users can choose to remove entries if desired. Using the calendar feature located at the top users may view entries from other days or weeks. The app utilizes asynchronous storage to save these entries, ensuring they are stored locally on the user’s device for privacy & quick access.

features.title: Settings
features.content: The settings page provides a straightforward interface for users to manage their experience. The ‘Interventions’ section lists various coping strategies saved in the asynchronous storage, ensuring that personal settings are securely stored & easily retrievable for each session. The ‘Dark Mode’ toggle is present but disabled as the app currently adheres to the system’s default settings. Additionally, a user may choose to ‘Sign out’ & ‘Delete Account,’ giving users control over their account management within Firebase.

futurePlans.title: Push Notifications
futurePlans.content: Implementation of push notifications to provide timely reminders & encourage consistent engagement with therapeutic activities.

futurePlans.title: Prompt Buttons
futurePlans.content: Leveraging our use of ChatGPT & chat summaries to provide better prompts for users.

futurePlans.title: Interventions
futurePlans.content: Allowing users to update interventions they find helps the most to get fast intervention for a rapidly approaching panic attack.

futurePlans.title: Dark Mode
futurePlans.content: Introducing a switch for Dark Mode, offering users the option to manually toggle this feature independent of system settings.

title: SHELF LIFE
description: ShelfLife is a game review website built with gamers in mind. With so many games & so many platforms, getting fast, relevant information, & curated reviews by trusted fellow gamers is important in influencing future purchases. Users are able to see up to date information on their favorite games, & find new ones that may interest them. They will also get relevant reviews for each game, published by other users of the application to help influence their purchasing decisions. Once a user creates an account, they will be able to post their own reviews for games, making their voice heard by the growing community on ShelfLife!
responsibilities: Designed & Developed various pages & components. Designed the individual game page, games page, user profile, multiple versions of the review component, & the initial game card in Figma. Developed the individual game page, review component, popup button functionality, & the average reviews histogram.

features.title: Technologies Used
features.content: JavaScript, MongoDB, Express JS, React, NodeJS, Vite, Tailwind CSS, Figma, Notion, Discord, GitHub.

features.title: Games Page
features.content: Displays dynamically generated lists of games based on categories (trending, top all time, recent). Each game card links to the corresponding game page.

features.title: Game Page
features.content: Dynamically generated pages showcasing different game stats & user reviews, with a modal for creating a review.

features.title: Login/Registration Pages
features.content: Uses Zod for schema validation & store user information in MongoDB.

features.title: User Page
features.content: Shows a list of favorites, recently played games, & user-submitted reviews.

features.title: Database Hosting
features.content: Can be hosted locally or online with MongoDB Atlas.

futurePlans.title: User Game Lists
futurePlans.content: Allow users to store & persist lists of games they are playing.

futurePlans.title: Likes & Comments
futurePlans.content: Enable adding likes & comments to reviews.

futurePlans.title: Certified Reviewers
futurePlans.content: Create a section for certified reviewers.

futurePlans.title: Follow Reviewers
futurePlans.content: Give users the ability to follow other reviewers
